meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here to dish out the dirt on Songs of Conquest. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, why should we care about another indie turn-based strategy game?" Well, let me tell you - this one's got heart, folks!

Now, I'm not gonna sugarcoat it; there are some criticisms out there. Eurogamer gave it a 60, saying that the battles can be punishing and uneven at times. Ouch! But hey, that's just part of the charm, right? Lavapotion's done something special here.

God is a Geek, on the other hand, loves this game with a fiery passion! They gave it a whopping 90, calling it "a stand-out hit." And I'm inclined to agree. The pixel art is simply stunning, and the gameplay is turn-based strategy at its finest.

IGN Italia also chimed in with a 90, praising Lavapotion's masterful additions to the turn-based gameplay. They're hoping for more content - who wouldn't? - and I'm right there with them!

GameStar gave it an 82, saying that Songs of Conquest revives the spirit of Heroes of Might and Magic 3. Not a bad thing, if you ask me! And The Games Machine gave it an 85, praising the balance between factions and the huge amount of content.

PC Games and TheGamer both gave it an 80, commending its game depth, scope, and welcoming difficulty curve. So yeah, there's no shortage of love for this game!

Now, I'm not gonna lie; I've played some turn-based strategy games in my time (okay, maybe too many). But Songs of Conquest has won me over with its charm, wit, and addictive gameplay. It's a must-play for any fan of the genre - trust me, you won't regret it!

And there you have it, folks! That's Hippo Penny's take on Songs of Conquest. Stay groovy, stay gamey, and see you in the next review!
